description: A JSON Schema that defines the structure of dynamic input parameters expected from the tool client. These parameters are mapped to the HTTP request and must conform to this schema.

type.description: Ensures the top-level type of the dynamic input schema is always an object.

description.description: A human-readable description for the entire dynamic input schema, providing context on its purpose.

properties.description: Defines the individual dynamic input parameters and how they are mapped to HTTP request components (path, query, header, or body).

aint_path.description: A map of dynamic path parameters, where each key corresponds to a segment in the URL path. Values must be strings, numbers, or booleans.

aint_query.description: A map of query parameters to be serialized into the URL. Each key-value pair represents a query parameter name and its value.

aint_headers.description: A set of HTTP headers to be provided dynamically by the client. Each key-value pair represents a header name and its value.

aint_body.description: Describes the HTTP request body's expected format. This can be defined as a JSON Schema object for structured payloads, or as a literal string to indicate a simple, unstructured text body.

oneOf.description: If the request body itself is a simple, unstructured string (e.g., 'text/plain'). The consumer will interpret this as the content type is text/plain with no further schema.
A JSON Schema object defining the structure of a structured request body (e.g., 'application/json').
